page.title: 02BATH HEADLINES 16/5/1985
page.content: Today the headlines in the "Evening Chronicle" were "BATH WELCOME, Â£15,000 ROBBERY." A newly arrived Bath couple got the worst kind of house warming present when thieves stole Â£15,000 worth of jewelry from their house in Grey Hill. Another headline was "JOBLESS RULE OF FEAR". Britain's high level of unemployment was not,it said, the result of international economic recession, but part of the Thatcher Government's "rule of fear". Another headline was:- "MOTHER IN BIZARRE DEATH RIDDLE".An inquest is due to open tomorrow into the bizarre death of a Bath mother following a fire. The last headline: "AVON ESCAPES SCHOOL BLOW."Avon has escaped the latest hit-list issued by Britain's second largest teachers' union,but children in both Wiltshire and Somerset face major disruptions.
